Animals are the central entities in a zoological garden. They are classified by species, each possessing unique biological and ecological characteristics.
Properties such as species name and species common name, and IUCN status characterize the species.
The species name adheres to international taxonomic standards, ensuring uniformity across scientific and conservation discourse, while the common name is how visitors usually refer to the species.
Enclosures are specialized habitats designed to mimic the natural environments of the resident species.
